instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v,  0v ppbus no short
threads.message:
water damage, clean all no shorts ppbus 0v usb 20v
usb was 5v and after 10sec get 20v i was replaced <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and now 5v 2sec and then 20v
j6951 was damage, now its o.k.
i was replaced ISL 3 time but the same..
ppbus 390 0.2v
SCL 300 , SDA 400 on J6951

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v,  0v ppbus no short
threads.message:
Try to release power button after 6-7s.

Without battery, charger alone, USB-C inputs switch to 20V (in normal mode)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v,  0v ppbus no short
threads.message:
Did..still PPBUS 0v
Normal mode switch to 20v
At bypass SMC stuck on 5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v,  0v ppbus no short
threads.message:
When tested in SMC bypass mode, should go to 20V, 2-3s after <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is released.

You may have problems with some signal not good from USB-C to SMC; or even something wrong around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v,  0v ppbus no short
threads.message:
I faced this problem with bad <SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> signal only.

Try checking/comparing voltage and diode mode to ground on other lines going to SMC...
